Question 71) Vegetation presents adaptations to the environment, such as tree and shrub plants with horizontally expanding roots, allowing strong anchoring in the muddy substrate; roots that expand vertically because of low substrate oxygenation; leaves that have glands to eliminate excess salts; Leaves that may have thick cuticle to reduce water loss by evaporation.
The described characteristics refer to plants adapted to the biome:
A) Cerrado.
B) Pampas.
C) Pantanal.
D) Mangrove.
E) Cocais forest.
